captions.text: - Just one more, just one more.
This alliteration might fool some people.

Ask someone, "What is the
word spelled S-H-O-P?"
What is the word spelled S-H-O-P?
- Then ask them, "What do you do
"when you come to a green light?"

- What do you do when you
come to a green light?
You don't stop at a green light.
- Their answer will most likely be wrong,

because they've been primed
to think of the wrong word.

Priming manipulates
people to think and act

Ask your friends to catch
a dollar from the midpoint.

Have to try to catch this
dollar from the midpoint.
So put your hand like right here.

- Do you think you can catch
this dollar from the midpoint?

- I can do it.
- Okay, okay, okay.
Can anyone do it, or is it just me?

It's a sure bet their reaction
time will be too slow,

because by the time
the brain processes it,

the dollar would've
already dropped too far.

- Don't get discouraged
if you can't do it.

title: Brain Tricks To Fool Your Friends
